comment._content: I always find it abit odd when one person of a married couple chooses to wear ethnic clothes and the other one wears western dress.  However it is usually the woman in the ethnic apparel

comment.author: 65365136@N00
comment._content: It looks like his wife might have been a Westerner.  She looks Caucasian.

comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: According to the New York Times: Persian Charges d'Affaire in Washington from 1909 to 1915 (when he was appointed Consul General to New York), he was married to Florence Breed of Boston. "Mirza" is a title of honor. Ref: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=980CE...

comment.author: 19838116@N00
comment._content: From US Department of State: www.state.gov/s/cpr/94046.htm Confirming Noel's comment, he was Charge d'Affaires for Iran/Persia.

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/toots] What he is wearing is not an ethnic dress. It's a royal uniform. He probably was coming back from an official visit to the White House.
